scenarios.name: Successful E2E Task Creation with Single User, File Upload, and Alignments
scenarios.description: Verifies the complete happy path from user login to creating a single task with a specific user assignment, alignment to an existing Priority and Huddle, and attaching a local file.
user_journey: Navigate to Application base URL.
Enter a valid email from Excel and click Continue.
Enter the corresponding valid password and click Login.
Select the specified company name from the list.
Click on 'Action Items' in the navigation menu.
Click on 'Tasks' from the submenu.
Click the 'New Task' button to open the form.
Enter the 'Short Task Name' from Excel.
Enter the 'Due Date' in MM/DD/YYYY format from Excel.
In the 'Search or Invite Team Members' field, enter a single user email from Excel.
Wait for the autocomplete dropdown and click the matching user to assign them.
In the 'Start typing to search Priorities' field, enter an existing priority name from Excel.
Wait for the autocomplete dropdown and click the matching priority to align it.
In the 'Start typing to search Huddles' field, enter an existing huddle name from Excel.
Wait for the autocomplete dropdown and click the matching huddle to align it.
Click the '+' icon next to Documents to open the upload dialog.
Enter the 'Document Name' and 'Document_Description' from Excel.
Ensure 'Document_Type' is 'File'.
Upload the specified 'Document_File' from the local file path.
Click the 'Save' button on the document dialog.
Click the final 'Save' button to create the task.
acceptance_criteria: User successfully logs in, selects a company, and navigates to the Manage Tasks page.
The task is created with the correct name, due date, and assigned user.
The task is successfully aligned with the specified Priority and Huddle.
The specified file is successfully attached to the newly created task.
The system returns to the Manage Tasks page, confirming successful creation.
test_data_requirements: A valid user Email and Password.
A valid Company_Name associated with the user.
A unique Task_Name.
A valid future Due_Date in MM/DD/YYYY format.
An Assigned_To field containing a single, existing user's email.
An Align_Priority field with the name of a pre-existing Priority.
An Align_Huddle field with the name of a pre-existing Huddle.
A Document_Name, Document_Description, Document_Type='File', and a Document_File that exists at the specified path.

scenarios.name: Successful Task Creation with 'Assign to all Users' Bulk Assignment
scenarios.description: Verifies that a task can be created and successfully assigned to all users in the company using the 'Assign to all Users' checkbox.
user_journey: User is logged in and on the Manage Tasks page.
Click the 'New Task' button.
Enter the 'Short Task Name' from Excel.
Enter the 'Due Date' from Excel.
Locate and click the 'Assign to all Users' checkbox to select it.
Click the 'Save' button to create the task.
acceptance_criteria: The 'Assign to all Users' checkbox is successfully selected.
The task is created successfully upon saving.
The system returns to the Manage Tasks page.
The created task is correctly assigned to all users in the system.
test_data_requirements: A unique Task_Name.
A valid future Due_Date in MM/DD/YYYY format.
The Assigned_To field in the Excel data must be 'Assign to all Users'.

scenarios.name: Successful Task Creation with Multiple Individual User Assignments
scenarios.description: Verifies a task can be successfully assigned to multiple specific team members by searching for and selecting their emails sequentially from the autocomplete dropdown.
user_journey: User is logged in and on the Manage Tasks page.
Click the 'New Task' button.
Enter the 'Short Task Name' from Excel.
Enter the 'Due Date' from Excel.
For each email in the comma-separated list from Excel:
a. Click the 'Search or Invite Team Members' input field.
b. Enter the user email address.
c. Wait for the autocomplete dropdown and click the matching user option to select them.
Click the 'Save' button to create the task.
acceptance_criteria: All specified users are successfully found and selected from the autocomplete dropdown.
The task is created successfully.
The created task is assigned to all specified individuals.
The system returns to the Manage Tasks page.
test_data_requirements: A unique Task_Name.
A valid future Due_Date in MM/DD/YYYY format.
The Assigned_To field in Excel must contain a comma-separated list of emails for at least two existing users (e.g., 'user1@example.com,user2@example.com').

scenarios.name: Successful Task Creation with a 'Link' Document Attachment
scenarios.description: Verifies a user can create a task and successfully attach a document of type 'Link' by providing a name, description, and a valid URL.
user_journey: User is logged in and on the Manage Tasks page.
Click the 'New Task' button.
Enter the 'Short Task Name' from Excel.
Enter the 'Due Date' from Excel.
Click the '+' icon next to Documents to open the upload dialog.
Enter the 'Document Name' from Excel.
Enter the 'Document_Description' from Excel.
Click the document type dropdown and select the 'Link' option.
Enter the 'Document_URL' from Excel into the 'Enter Link...' field.
Click the 'Save' button on the document dialog.
Click the final 'Save' button to create the task.
acceptance_criteria: The document dialog opens and the type is successfully changed to 'Link'.
The document name, description, and URL are entered correctly.
The link document is successfully saved and attached to the task.
The task is created successfully and the system returns to the Manage Tasks page.
test_data_requirements: A unique Task_Name.
A valid future Due_Date in MM/DD/YYYY format.
A Document_Name, Document_Description, Document_Type='Link', and a valid Document_URL (e.g., 'https://example.com/doc').

scenarios.name: Successful Sequential Creation of Multiple Tasks in a Single Session
scenarios.description: Verifies the data-driven flow where the system processes multiple rows from an Excel file, creating each task sequentially without requiring the user to log in again.
user_journey: For the FIRST task in the Excel file, execute the full login and navigation flow (PHASE 1).
Execute the task creation steps (PHASE 2) for the first task.
Verify the system is on the Manage Tasks page.
For the SECOND and subsequent tasks in the Excel file, skip the login flow.
Directly execute the task creation steps (PHASE 2) for each subsequent task.
Continue until all tasks from the Excel file are created.
acceptance_criteria: The user logs in only once at the beginning of the test session.
Each task defined in the Excel file is created successfully in sequence.
The user remains on the Manage Tasks page between task creations.
The entire batch of tasks is processed without session timeout or unexpected logout.
test_data_requirements: An Excel file containing at least two valid and distinct task definitions.
The first row must contain valid login credentials (Email, Password, Company_Name).
Subsequent rows can have varied, but valid, data for task creation (e.g., different assignment types, with/without documents).

edge_cases: Creating a task with a due date set to the last day of a leap year (e.g., 02/29/2028).
Uploading a file with a very long filename containing spaces and special characters.
Assigning a task to a user whose email is a substring of another existing user's email to ensure the correct one is selected from the dropdown.
Creating a task with only the mandatory fields (Task Name, Due Date, one assignee) and no optional data.
dependencies: The test environment must be pre-seeded with all users, Priorities, and Huddles specified in the test data Excel file.
A stable internet connection is required for the application to load and respond within the defined timeouts.
The test data Excel file must be correctly formatted and contain valid, accurate data.
For file upload scenarios, the specified files must exist at the hardcoded 'File_Upload_Base_Path' on the execution machine.
